line_1: (Who lie in praise, will lie in satire)
line_2: Alike, if they revile or flatter,

line_1: Yet dare I, spite of Critic Satire,
line_2: Suppose the Standing Dish GOOD NATURE?

line_1: But with the friends of Vice, the foes of SATIRE,
line_2: All truth is spleen; all just reproof, ill-nature.

line_1: I pray on me make satire;
line_2: I hate to hear you flatter.

line_1: Had armed with spirit, wit, and satire:
line_2: And tipped her arrows with good-nature.
And when you'd think He means to flatter,
" Young BILLY PENWAGGLE, and SIMIUS CHATTER,
